explains: n. 暗示；略知；模糊概念
v. 暗示（inkle 的 ing 形式）；略知；低声说出

sentences.en: "Digital textbooks are not going to catch on," says Inkling CEO Matt Maclnnis as he's giving me a demo over coffee.
sentences.cn: “电子教科书不会流行起来。”Inkling 的首席执行官马特·麦克尼斯边喝咖啡边给我做演示边说。

sentences.en: He had no inkling of what was going on.
sentences.cn: 他对正在发生的事情一无所知。

sentences.en: I had no inkling of his real purpose until much later.
sentences.cn: 直到后来很久我才略微知道他的真实目的。
